content: if they irritate you funfetti page 2 cuff with your first yarn colour and the smaller needle size cast on 64/72/80 sts close to a round taking care not to twist the sts work k1tbl p1 rib for as many rounds as you would like your cuff to be i normally work 24 rounds bear in mind that your leg length will have to be a multiple of 24 rounds so that you can place the heel within a solid colour strip because i wanted to have 3 repeats = 72 rounds on my leg i decided to work the cuff for only 12 rounds on my sample sock if you only want to work your leg for 48 rounds i would suggest a longer cuff as stranded colourwork benefits from a more substantial cuff depending on how tightly you cast on whether you have a high instep or very pronounced calves you may find that you are more comfortable with a roomier cuff for my own socks i sometimes cast on up to 80 sts for the cuff and decrease to the actual st count in the first leg round leg work one plain knit round then change to the bigger needle size and work another plain knit round these are the first two row of chart a now work the remainder of chart a in stranded colourwork followed by the whole of chart b and the whole of chart c if you want a longer leg heel still using the yarn you have ended the leg with work the heel over the half the sts i e 32/36/40 sts working back and forth in row in order to place the vertical jog in the pattern in the centre back the first row of the heel will only be partial i e over 16/18/20 sts leave the sts not in use i e the instep sts on the cables of the circular needles and use the smaller size needles to work the heel row1 k1 sl1 8/9/10 times turn row2 sl1 p31/35/39 turn row3 sl1 k1 to end turn row4 sl1 p to end turn row5 sl1 sl1 k1 to last st k1 turn row6 sl1 p to end turn row 3 to 6 form the eye of partridge heel pattern repeat these until you have worked 38/42/46 rounds in total although this is personal preference and will depend on the height of your instep after finishing the heel flap turn the heel as follows row1 sl1 k1 8/9/10 times k1 ssk k1 turn row2 sl1 p3 p2tog p1 turn row3 sl1 k to 1 st before the gap ssk k1 turn row4 sl1 p to 1 st before the gap p2tog p1 turn repeat the last 2 row until you have used up all the sts on your needles ending with a row 4 and 18/20/22 sts on your needle k 9/10/11 this is the centre back of your sock and the new beginning of your rounds funfetti
